proposed_strategy.name: Single Chunk Prapāṭhaka Processing
proposed_strategy.description: The entire Prapāṭhaka is processed as a single chunk because the total character count is significantly below the safety limit. Chunk boundaries are based on the main structural unit (Prapāṭhaka).

execution_plan.description: Complete Second Prapāṭhaka (Khaṇḍas 1-24) including introductory and concluding material.

parsing_instructions.justification: The primary semantic divisions within the Prapāṭhaka are the Khandas, which are clearly demarcated by headings and explicit commentary colophons.

start_pattern.description: A new Khanda begins with a bolded Devanagari ordinal number followed by 'खण्डः'.

end_pattern.description: The end of a Khanda's commentary is marked by a specific concluding line using Devanagari ordinals, often surrounded by double dots.

parsing_instructions.pre_content_handling: The Prapāṭhaka title should be considered the global heading. Content starts immediately with the first Khanda heading.
